Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk openscap
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: openscap bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The OpenSCAP suite enables integration of the Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) line of standards. The openscap packages provide the OpenSCAP library and the oscap utility that provides various SCAP capabilities. The openscap packages have been upgraded to upstream version 1.2.5, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. Most notably, this update adds support for the Open Vulnerability and Assessment Language (OVAL) standard version 5.11 which introduces tests for the systemd service properties and other enhancements. In addition, this update provides the following enhancements: Native support for the xml.bz2 input files The oscap-ssh utility for assessing remote systems The oscap-docker utility for assessing containers and images (BZ#1202868) This update also fixes the following bugs: Previously, the oscap utility scanner did not correctly handle security policies in the Extensible Configuration Checklist Document Format (XCCDF) containing a dangling selector element that did not resolve to a valid target. When the user scanned such policy, the oscap scanner terminated unexpectedly with a segmentation fault. Now, the oscap utility displays a warning to the user whenever it encounters a dangling selector and continues scanning. (BZ#1220944) The scap-as-rpm utility did not honor the "--srpm-destination" option. When the user passed "--srpm-destination" to scap-as-rpm, scap-as-rpm did not build the source RPM (SRPM). The problem has been fixed, and passing "--srpm-destination" to scap-as-rpm now builds the SRPM and saves it to the specified location as expected. (BZ#1242893) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: The HTML report of a security vulnerability discovered by the oscap scanner now includes a link to the related Red Hat Security Advisory if it exists. The link enables the user to find more details about security vulnerabilities discovered by the scanner. (BZ#1243808) Users of openscap are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
